content.text:
# The Kings of Nuthin' / The Briggs

The Briggs
| released =
| recorded = 2004
| studio   = The Outpost, Stoughton, MA
| genre    =
* Rockabilly
* psychobilly
* punk rock
| length   = 6:11
| label    = Disaster Records
| writer   =
*Mac Rebennack
*Seth David
*Dewey Terry
*Don Harris
*Chris Arredondo
*Joey LaRocca
| producer      = Duane Peters
}}
"'''The Kings of Nuthin' / The Briggs'''" is a split 7 by Boston-based punk rock and rockabilly band The Kings of Nuthin' and punk rock band The Briggs based out of Los Angeles. It was released in 2004 through Disaster Records.
Recording and composition
The A-side of the split 7 "The Kings of Nuthin' / The Briggs" was recorded and mixed by Jim Siegel and the B-side by Jerry Adamowicz at The Outpost studios, Stoughton, MA. The first two songs of that single were recorded by the Kings of Nuthin' and the third song was recorded by the Briggs.
Release and reception
The split 7 "The Kings of Nuthin' / The Briggs" was released in 2004, through Disaster Records.
Track listing and formats

* Spike Katz – upright bass (1,2)
* Liam Crill – drums (1,2)
* Chris Wilkinson – washboard (1,2)
* Slick – baritone saxophone (1,2)
* Tommy Bellevue – tenor saxophone (1,2)
* Jason LaRocca – electric guitar, lead vocals (3)
* Duck Matthews – bass guitar, backing vocals (3)
* Chris Arredondo – drums (3)
Technical

* Jerry Adamowicz – mixer, recording engineer (3)
Artwork and design
